name: Nitro
body:
## Overview Nitro is a programmer-directed code variant tuning framework, jointly developed by the [University of Utah](http://www.cs.utah.edu) and [NVIDIA Research](http://research.nvidia.com). ## Publications Check out the following paper for an overview of Nitro's design, and some initial results showcasing Nitro's effectiveness. [**Nitro: A Framework for Adaptive Code Variant Tuning**](http://www.cs.utah.edu/docs/nitro_ipdps2014.pdf)
S. Muralidharan, M. Shantharam, M. Hall, M. Garland, B. Catanzaro; Proceedings of the 28th IEEE International Parallel & Distributed Processing Symposium, pp. 501-512, May 2014, Phoenix (Arizona) USA
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
